Parents/Guardians,

Bottineau Public School would like to announce that we will be providing free breakfast and lunch to students that are enrolled K-12 beginning immediately under USDA guidance. Free meals will be offered through December 31st, 2020 or until USDA funding runs out, whichever comes first. If funding ends unexpectedly before December 31st, we will let you know through our normal parent communication methods.

All lunch balances will remain at their current level until the USDA funding runs out, at which time normal breakfast and lunch charges will resume.

Also, we strongly encourage that families continue to complete the Free and Reduced applications as this will insure that students will receive free/ reduced meals without interference and is needed to help with educational funding sources.

If you have any questions or concerns, please contact Kelly Olson at 701-228-2266, Ext 113.

Sincerely,

Kelly Olson, Foodservice Director

As we find ourselves a week into the month of May, our thoughts turn towards the end of the school year. Without question, this school year has brought most unique challenges to all of us, including a unique conclusion to our 2019-2020 school year. School lunch will continue to be offered until May 29th.

We want to extend our sincere gratitude to our students and parents/guardians for your support, understanding, and efforts during this unprecedented time in education.

From: Pat Brenden, Superintendent
Date: March 14, 2020
RE: School Closure on Monday, March 16, 2020

The Bottineau Public School has made the decision to continue to operate school at this time. This decision was made with guidance from the ND Department of Health, and the Governor’s Office, we utilized the same information provided to all schools in ND.

With that being said, Bottineau PSD will be implementing a variety of measure that have been recommended and can best be described as precautionary. For us to implement these with fidelity, we need time to meet with our employees and go over these changes in detail. This cannot be done if we have 650+ student in the building. I know that this will be an inconvenience for some of you; but know that we believe it is the best way to prepare our staff for what we are going to ask them to do.

Please follow the Districts webpage, Facebook page and App, as I will be sending additional information out to you later today.

All employees must report to work at your regular time, we will meet in the auditorium at 9:00 a.m.
